home.title: Deciphering molecular mechanisms of adaptation and defense
home.description: The Bioinformatics and Functional Genomics Laboratory, led by Dr. Elsa Góngora Castillo, is part of the Department of Marine Resources at the Center for Research and Advanced Studies of the National Polytechnic Institute (Cinvestav-IPN), Mérida Unit, located in Mérida, Yucatán, Mexico.
home.description2: Our research program focuses on understanding the molecular responses and genomic adaptations during interactions with pathogenic organisms and environmental changes in coastal and terrestrial organisms, primarily plants and animals. We aim to unravel the mechanisms of molecular defense systems and their genetic regulation using advanced high-throughput sequencing strategies and bioinformatics tools.
home.contact: For more information, feel free to contact us here. We are always looking for enthusiastic individuals to join our lab!

history.title: A Brief History of the Laboratory
history.content: The Bioinformatics and Functional Genomics Laboratory was established by Dr. Elsa Góngora Castillo, who completed her Ph.D studies at Cinvestav Irapuato, Guanajuato, Mexico. She then pursued postdoctoral fellowships at Michigan State University and North Carolina State University, gaining bioinformatics and functional genomics expertise. Upon returning to Mexico, she joined the Center for Scientific Research of Yucatán (CICY) as part of the "Investigadoras e Investigadores por México" program. Currently, she leads this laboratory at Cinvestav Mérida, focusing on understanding the molecular defense and adaptation mechanisms to climate change of coastal and terrestrial organisms.

papaya.title: Genome sequencing of wild and commercial papaya
papaya.description: This project aims to identify defense-related genes in papaya (Carica papaya) by analyzing the genomic differences between wild and commercial varieties to understand the genetic changes during domestication

chlamydomonas.title: Gene regulation in response to stress in Chlamydomonas reinhardtii
chlamydomonas.description: Using bioinformatics tools, this project studies gene regulation of the green microalga Chlamydomonas reinhardtii under various stress conditions. The goal is to understand and optimize lipid production for biotechnological applications.

vanilla.title: Transcriptome and metagenome analysis in commercial and wild vanilla
vanilla.description: By studying transcriptomes and metagenomes, this project explores the genetic and functional diversity in vanilla, comparing commercial and wild varieties to identify key genes related to adaptation and cultivation.

pi.title: Principal Investigator
pi.name: Dr. Elsa B. Góngora Castillo
pi.bio: My research group focuses on plant-pathogen interaction, defense systems, and genetic regulation. We utilize high-throughput sequencing and bioinformatics to analyze different organisms' metagenomes, transcriptomes, and genomes.
